title: BMO Field to host 2016 Grey Cup: Source
text:
The Grey Cup is coming back to Toronto. 
And with it might come the Winter Classic. 
The Toronto Sun has learned that the 2016 Grey Cup will be staged at the newly-renovated BMO Field. It is expected to attract a capacity crowd of 40,000. 
A Canadian Football League source confirmed to the Sun on Wednesday morning that the game will be held on Nov. 27, 2016, four years after the CFL chose Toronto to host the league's 100th championship game. 
MLSE is in the midst of a $120-million renovation that has already expanded BMO Field by 8,000 seats. 
Phase II of the project is underway and will see BMO Field covered by roofing on three sides. 
NHL commissioner Gary Bettman in July would not rule out BMO Field as a possible host site for the 2016-17 Winter Classic outdoor game. 
That year is the 100th anniversary of the Toronto Maple Leafs franchise. 
"We'll have to see," Bettman told the Sun at the time about BMO Field's future chances of staging an outdoor NHL game. "It's not a no, it's not a yes. It's, 'We'll have to see.' 
"We haven't focused on the outdoor games for the season after this. But if BMO is ready for an outdoor game, and the Leafs want us to take a look at it, we'll take a look." 
The Toronto Argonauts are scheduled to move into BMO Field in time for the start of next season as part of a deal that saw MLSE chairman Larry Tanenbaum and Bell purchase the team in May. 
The Grey Cup could conflict with Major League Soccer's playoffs should Toronto FC advance as far as the Eastern Conference final in 2016. Sponsored Links
